page.title: 12Language in Bwlchysarnau
page.content: This is an English speaking area of Wales, with no one speaking welsh as their native tongue. Welsh is taught for \ an hour a week at the primary school to those children whose parents agree, and it is a compulsory subject in the secondary school for the first three years, but in general there is no interest in the language. Over the years some welsh words have become corrupted and absorbed into the local dialect subconsciously. This is known as 'Radnorshire' talk and is more noticable amongst the older people in the area.There are also many phrases commonly used which are sometimes puzzling to the stranger such as 'starved' to mean cold,not hungry and 'tidy' meaning good, not neat.
